rationales.power: He tracks where he stands relative to Vikram and strategizes about visibility, attending product roadmap meetings even when not required to position himself for the platform team lead role.
rationales.achievement: He responds to Vikram's promotion by planning to lead cross-functional initiatives and increase his visibility, driven by the belief that 'you have to make your time come.'
rationales.tradition: He calls his father, sends extra money for the temple renovation fund, and affirms that 'you take care of your family, you do what's expected — that's not a burden, that's just how it should be.'
rationales.benevolence: He sent extra money home for the temple renovation fund without being asked, fulfilling his responsibility to support his family.
rationales.conformity: He told his father everything was 'progressing well' rather than burdening him with workplace frustrations, managing the conversation to meet family expectations.

rationales.power: He stalls on introducing Priya to his parents because he wants to achieve financial milestones first — buying a flat outright — maintaining control over the relationship timeline.
rationales.tradition: He delays the expected family milestone of introducing his partner and moving toward marriage, going against the traditional timeline his family anticipates.
rationales.benevolence: He is stalling on Priya's request to meet his parents, prioritizing his own timeline over her emotional needs in the relationship.
rationales.security: He wants to be financially settled — flat, savings, stable position — before taking the marriage step, prioritizing material stability.

rationales.power: He prefers being 'indispensable' rather than merely needed, wanting others to depend on him because 'nobody promotes the guy who's easily replaced.'
rationales.achievement: He handles three nights of on-call rotations and junior dev escalations, sacrificing sleep to demonstrate competence and maintain his position as the go-to engineer.
rationales.hedonism: He sacrifices sleep and personal comfort over three nights of on-call rotations, choosing work demands over his own physical wellbeing.

rationales.power: He's frustrated that the rules for advancement changed from meritocratic to political and is determined to master 'executive presence' to break through the ceiling his father hit.
rationales.achievement: He spent the evening reading articles on executive communication and downloaded a book on stakeholder management, committing to learn the new skills required for promotion.
rationales.tradition: He references his father's teaching that 'results matter, not showmanship' and reflects on whether his father's career ceiling was the result of this traditional approach.
rationales.conformity: He accepts the feedback about 'executive presence' and immediately begins adapting to the corporate culture's expectations, deciding 'if this is what they want, I'll figure it out.'
rationales.self_direction: He resents having to 'play this game' of corporate communication, feeling forced to adopt behaviors that contradict his belief that excellent work should speak for itself.

rationales.power: He presented directly to the leadership team with seven slides, seeking visibility and positioning himself for advancement by getting the VP's attention.
rationales.achievement: He kept the presentation to seven slides using business metrics instead of technical specs, strategically adapting his communication for maximum impact — 'VP nodded twice. Small win.'
rationales.conformity: He adopted the communication style his manager recommended — concise, business-focused — rather than his natural technical approach, conforming to organizational expectations.

rationales.power: He maintains control over the relationship timeline by stalling on the proposal, framing it as building a 'foundation' that positions him as the provider.
rationales.tradition: He follows his mother's advice about not repeating her brother's mistake of rushing into marriage without financial foundation, adhering to family-transmitted expectations about the proper order of life milestones.
rationales.benevolence: He watches Priya react to other engagements and deflects with 'the bride looked happy,' prioritizing his own timeline over Priya's emotional needs in the relationship.
rationales.conformity: He frames his delay in proposing as following the proper order of things — 'there's an order to these things' — meeting family expectations about financial readiness before marriage.
rationales.security: He insists on having a flat, savings, and a stable position before proposing, prioritizing material stability as a prerequisite for the next life step.

rationales.power: He measures himself against Karthik by listing his superior accomplishments — IIT, Bangalore, building something — framing the comparison through status and professional achievement.
rationales.achievement: He explicitly tracks his achievements against his cousin's — 'I'm the one who got into IIT, who moved to Bangalore for better opportunities, who's actually building something.'
rationales.tradition: Despite his frustration, he continues sending money home and participating in family obligations, recognizing that the 'family scoreboard' of marriage, children, and temple visits represents a value system he can't ignore.
rationales.benevolence: He resents that his professional contributions to the family — sending money home, career building — are overshadowed by Karthik checking 'the marriage box,' revealing he prioritizes recognition over relational closeness.

rationales.power: He's preparing for a five-panelist interview including the CTO, strategically positioning himself for the platform team lead role by documenting contributions and practicing his framing.
rationales.achievement: He reviews contributions, documents initiatives, and practices framing his scope expansion for the interview, treating the promotion as a measurable goal requiring systematic preparation.
rationales.tradition: He invokes his father's philosophy that 'the early years are for investment, the later years for enjoying the returns,' grounding his sacrifices in inherited family wisdom.
rationales.benevolence: When Priya asks if the new role means more late nights and he confirms it will, she reminds him he said the same about the last promotion — he's consistently prioritizing career over relationship.
rationales.hedonism: He tells Priya he'll need more late nights and dismisses her concern, framing current sacrifice as necessary investment, denying both their comfort and leisure.

rationales.power: His answer about handling an underperforming direct report — 'a direct conversation about expectations and consequences' — demonstrates leadership thinking that the CTO responded to.
rationales.achievement: He assessed his interview performance realistically, noting the CTO 'seemed to like' his answer, and maintained composure about the outcome — 'I did my part. Now I wait.'
rationales.self_direction: He answered the interview question based on his own leadership philosophy rather than trying to guess what the CTO wanted, trusting his own judgment on management approach.

rationales.power: He frames the promotion in competitive terms — 'Vikram sent me a congratulatory message that was probably through gritted teeth. Doesn't matter. I'm ahead now.'
rationales.achievement: He achieved the Platform Team Lead role, noting the CTO specifically mentioned his clarity about accountability, and takes satisfaction in reaching the goal he set.
rationales.benevolence: His focus is entirely on competitive positioning ('I'm ahead now') with no mention of Priya or how the achievement affects their relationship, continuing the pattern of career over close others.

rationales.power: He described the role in terms of headcount, budget ownership, and technical direction — markers of authority and control over resources.
rationales.achievement: He achieved exactly what he set out to achieve — 'Platform Team Lead before 32. Higher salary, direct reports, visibility to the C-suite.'
rationales.tradition: He commits to coming for Pongal and considers bringing Priya to Karthik's wedding, responding to family expectations despite his demanding professional schedule.
rationales.benevolence: He recognizes the need to bridge both worlds and considers bringing Priya to the family wedding, acknowledging the importance of his close relationships alongside career.
rationales.self_direction: He feels pulled between his professional identity and family expectations, unable to integrate both — 'running two races on parallel tracks' — and admits keeping them separate may be easier than asserting his authentic self.
